text: I'm not familiar with the hsVideoAPI, but I think you should be able to add an `autoplay` attribute in your video embed tag. Alternatively, if you're hosting your video somewhere else, there should be an option from the video host to enable autoplay on your videos. I think this should solve it without any code. Just a guess though :slightly_smiling_face:

Quick inspection of your code showed you have *two ids for `agenda` .* This will  alway result in odd behavior and is not semantic. Keep only 1 id at the top level element and it should fix the problem :slightly_smiling_face:
```<div id="agenda" class="module_1673304172244__scope cell-section scope agenda section-layout--below section--dark "> <div class="scope__background"></div>  <div class="scope__overlay"></div> <div class="scope__container"> <div class="scope__row"> <div class="scope__col col--content"> <div class="scope__wrap wrap--content"> <div class="scope__heading animate" data-duration="1500" data-origin="center" data-distance="0px" data-delay=".5" data-opacity="0" data-scale="1"> <h2>Agenda</h2></div> <div class="scope__small-title"><h5>Just a glimpse of some of our amazing programming. </h5></div>   <div class="scope__content "><div class="scroll-element-hidden" data-scroll-element="agenda-section">&nbsp;</div><a name="agenda" id="agenda" data-hs-anchor="true"></a></div>```
